newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore rubber ends mostly steady in soft market.
newsitem.headline: Singapore rubber ends mostly steady in soft market.

text.p: Rubber futures closed mostly steady on Wednesday in a sluggish market which was weighed down by the poor Japanese market and a holiday in Thailand, dealers said.
"It's a miserable market. Nobody wanted to do anything with Japan performing so poorly and Thailand out on a holiday," a local rubber trader said.
Prices of Tokyo's benchmark March contract fell by 0.8 yen to end at 134.5 while Kobe's March contract settled at 134.8, down 0.1 yen from yesterday's settlement.
Offers for forward purchases were brushed aside by potential buyers, the dealers said.
"When you have very little offtake, it's practically a dead market," one trader said.
December RSS3 was seen at 124.25-125.25 U.S. cents a kg from yesterday's 125.25 cents.
December RSS1 was seen at 177.50-178.50 Singapore cents (US$1.26-$1.27) a kg from the previous 178.25 cents.
December TSR20 was also seen at 171.75-173.75 Singapore cents (US$1.22-$1.23) a kg against the previous 173.75 cents.
